title: Basic Operations
what: Basic operations are the four main math skills: addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division. These are used in almost all math problems.
steps:
1. Understand what each operation does.
  2. Practice solving small problems with each.
  3. Try combining operations in one expression.
  4. Apply to real-life examples like money, time, or distance.

sections.title: Addition
sections.what: Addition means putting things together to find the total.
sections.steps:
1. Line up the numbers by place value.
  2. Start from the rightmost digit.
  3. Add digits column by column.
  4. Carry over if needed.

sections.title: Adding with Carrying
sections.what: When a column adds to more than 9, you carry over to the next column.
sections.steps:
1. Add right digits.
  2. If 10 or more, write unit digit and carry 1.
  3. Add next column with carry.

sections.title: Subtraction
sections.what: Subtraction means taking away or finding the difference between numbers.
sections.steps:
1. Line up numbers.
  2. Start from the right.
  3. If needed, borrow from the next column.
  4. Subtract each column.

sections.title: Subtraction with Borrowing
sections.what: When the top number is smaller than the bottom, borrow from the next column.
sections.steps:
1. Check if top digit is smaller.
  2. Borrow from next digit (turn 10s into units).
  3. Subtract as usual.

sections.title: Multiplication
sections.what: Multiplication is repeated addition. It shows how many times one number is added.
sections.steps:
1. Write the two numbers.
  2. Multiply each digit starting from the right.
  3. Shift left for each new row.
  4. Add up the rows.

sections.title: Multiplying Two-Digit Numbers
sections.what: Multiply each digit of the bottom number with the top number, one at a time.

sections.title: Division
sections.what: Division means splitting into equal parts or groups.
sections.steps:
1. See how many times the divisor fits into the dividend.
  2. Write down the result.
  3. Subtract and bring down the next digit.
  4. Repeat until done.

sections.title: Long Division
sections.what: A step-by-step method for dividing big numbers.
sections.steps:
1. Divide the first part of the number.
  2. Multiply and subtract.
  3. Bring down next digit.
  4. Repeat process.
